item.title: Mad for Rachel Maddow
item.description: Will Maddow's unlikely success, reliant on her ability to defy cliche, signal a move in punditry away from the thuggish and toward the sophisticated?
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Traister, The Nation

item.title: Why Obama Could be in Trouble
item.description: Instead of acting like journalists, the mainstream media have become McCain's personal assistants, regurgitating his B.S. without question.
item.dc:creator: Robert Parry, Consortium News

item.title: Is Your Organic Food Really Organic?
item.description: Imported foods found with unacceptable pesticide levels have drawn attention to the USDA's shoddy certification process.
item.dc:creator: Jill Richardson, AlterNet

item.title: Are Contractors in War Zones Above the Law?
item.description: Numerous private civilian contractors have died in Iraq under KBR's watch, yet the firm is immune from U.S. law.
item.dc:creator: Daphne Eviatar, Washington Independent

item.title: If We Drill in the U.S., We Don't Get the Oil
item.description: The oil that comes from offshore drilling will belong to the multinational firm, like Exxon-Mobil and will go to world markets, not us.
item.dc:creator: Cenk Uygur, Huffington Post

item.title: Amy Goodman: Army Recruiter Threatens High School Student with Jail Time
item.description: A Texas army recruiter was recently suspended for telling a teenager he would be sent to jail if he chose college over the military.
item.dc:creator: Amy Goodman

item.title: Robert Scheer: The New Face of Terrorism? A Square White Guy
item.description: The deadliest ontological assault on the United States may have been perpetrated by a church-going white man, with anthrax from our own weapons labs.
item.dc:creator: Robert Scheer

item.title: Mark Weisbrot: Offshore Drilling Won't Help, But "Green Stimulus" Can
item.description: A "green stimulus" package would give the economy a lift while simultaneously reducing energy consumption.
item.dc:creator: Mark Weisbrot

item.title: David Sirota: Want to Learn About Politics? Go to the Movies
item.description: Many filmic treatments of Washington present a more hard-edged political reality than most of today's so-called journalism.
item.dc:creator: David Sirota

item.title: Sean Gonsalves: Respected Academic Denied Entry into U.S.
item.description: Our government finds it necessary to protect Americans from academics who disagree with Bush.
item.dc:creator: Sean Gonsalves

item.title: Deb Price: Congress Reconsiders Ban on Gays in the Military
item.description: The hearing was an important first step in repealing an un-American law that hurts the military by pushing away talented gays and lesbians.
item.dc:creator: Deb Price

item.title: Norman Solomon: Fund Health Care, Not War
item.description: The old claims of a justified war in Iraq have melted away. So have promises of a humane society back at home.
item.dc:creator: Norman Solomon

item.title: Susie Bright: Finally, Marriage Licenses for All
item.description: The legalization of gay marriage is a huge milestone in the fight for equal rights. Still, it begs the question: why do people get married, anyway?
item.dc:creator: Susie Bright

item.title: 13 Workers Dead: A Look at the 'Shocking' and "Disgraceful' Imperial Sugar Tragedy
item.description: VP at Imperial Sugar admits that working conditions at the plant where an explosion took the lives of 13 workers earlier this year were terrible.
item.dc:creator: Phil Mattera, Dirt Diggers Digest

item.title: Justice Department to Question Former Lawyers in Politicization Probe
item.description: As the Bush era comes to a close, the Justice Department starts to question the administration's selective enforcement of voting rights law.
item.dc:creator: Murray Waas, Huffington Post

item.title: 7 Reasons Parents Should Not Test Kids for Drug Use
item.description: Why experts say drug testing should be left to the professionals.
item.dc:creator: Lindsay Lyon, U.S. News & World Report

item.title: The Strange Death of Republican America
item.description: Today no one can even envision when the Republicans will control the presidency and both houses of the Congress as they did just two years ago.
item.dc:creator: Sidney Blumenthal, Huffington Post

item.title: The Role of Agribusiness in Our Food Crisis
item.description: Ethanol critics need to be wary before they jump aboard the anti-ethanol campaigns and let off the hook the real bad actors behind our food crisis.
item.dc:creator: George Naylor, Irene Lin, AlterNet

item.title: McCain's "League of Democracies" Proposal, Rejected by Allies, Gains Traction with Hawks on Left and Right
item.description: McCain's "League of Democracies," a new international organization of democratic governments, already exists.
item.dc:creator: Ali Gharib, IPS News

item.title: Black Women More Likely to Die in Childbirth than Whites or Latinas
item.description: A state review of maternal mortality seeks to find out why. But some hospitals refuse to participate.
item.dc:creator: Malena Amusa, Women's eNews

item.title: Shock and Tasers in New Orleans
item.description: The shameless exploitation of poor New Orleans residents to privatize public infrastructure is being enforced by violence and tasers.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Klein, Huffington Post

item.title: Immigrant Raids Must Stop
item.description: Why do we treat those who work the longest hours at the most undesirable jobs like terrorists?
item.dc:creator: Rep. Luis Gutierrez, Rep. Joe Baca, Chicago Tribune

item.title: North Carolina Paper Covers the John Edwards Allegations -- Carefully
item.description: Love child allegations about Edwards remain so far unproven. One paper decides to cover the story properly.
item.dc:creator: Clint Hendler, Columbia Journalism Review

item.title: Want to Learn About Politics? Go to the Movies
item.description: Many filmic treatments of Washington present a more hard-edged political reality than most of today's so-called journalism.
item.dc:creator: David Sirota, Creators Syndicate

item.title: Black Women More Likely to Die in Childbirth than Whites or Latinas
item.description: A state review of maternal mortality seeks to find out why. But some hospitals refuse to participate.
item.dc:creator: Malena Amusa, Women's eNews

item.title: Army Recruiter Threatens High School Student with Jail Time
item.description: A Texas army recruiter was recently suspended for telling a teenager he would be sent to jail if he chose college over the military.
item.dc:creator: Amy Goodman, Democracy Now!

item.title: Who Marriage Is For: A Tale of Two Weddings
item.description: Gay marriage is drastically changing the institution of marriage. And that's a very, very good thing.
item.dc:creator: Greta Christina, Greta Christina's Blog

item.title: Army Recruiter Threatens High School Student with Jail Time
item.description: A Texas army recruiter was recently suspended for telling a teenager he would be sent to jail if he chose college over the military.
item.dc:creator: Amy Goodman, Democracy Now!

item.title: The Problem Is Simple: Too Many People, Too Much Stuff
item.description: An equitable and humane solution to overpopulation and overconsumption may actually be possible.
item.dc:creator: Paul & Anne Ehrlich, Yale Environment 360
